TopicTitle: Anyone have memory issues spring out of nowhere?

Articles.Content:
I'm running a ton of mods so I know that that's the problem. What I don't understand is why yesterday the game started fine, barely reaching 3.2 Gb RAM before the memory reduction plugin did its thing and dropped it to a stable 2.6Gb. Now today, it gets barely halfway loaded before hitting 3.7GB and crashing. I even completely removed 300Mb of mods and it still can't load completely without crashing. I've changed nothing at all, KSP just suddenly hates memory.

I was able to run B9, KW, Interstellar, Kethane, HOME, LLL, Near Future, UniverseReplacer and a couple others alongside about thirty plugin mods. Now even getting rid of HOME, Interstellar, and UniverseReplacer can't even put a dent in the memory use...

Edited January 1, 2014 by Frostiken

Okay, I need the following things from you.

total RAM for your system

total mod and plugin list after you cut stuff out

anything you are running alongside KSP

anything you changed between the last time it worked and the first time it didn't

Issues like this typically don't spring from nowhere. It's not impossible but fairly unlikely. Universe replacer and Interstellar are big ones, cutting those should help. B9, as optimized as it is, eats a lot. Nix B9, then try. I can give you some more suggestions on what to kick if you can list those "thirty plugin mods." If your computer only has 4 GB memory, you may be eating into KSP's memory with running stuff alongside it. If you are like me and have 8GB, you can run KSP twice over without crashing (lol, I have actually done this). Even if your mod load did not change, sometimes a system setting can effect memory allocation. Even if you haven't changed anything in your KSP or it's mods, something you might think is completely unrelated could do something as memory crashes, though I personally have only seen it once, can be brought on by non-KSP changes.

Best help I can say now is cut the most memory intensive mods. After UniverseReplacer and Interstellar got removed, the only biggie I can see is B9. Kick that. If you are still crashing, try to give us what I labeled above. It's probably more than anyone could need but it gives us more info to help you.

B9 and, to a lesser extent KW, tend to be the ones that rapidly cause memory problems. B9 does come with a reduced texture pack, make sure you install that or you will be close to having problems with B9 alone installed nevermind any other mods. I think KW has reduced texture packs available as well, so make sure you get both. Interstellar is fairly big but not on the scale of those two.

Actually, wait, I dun goofed, problem solved. When I was messing with City Light / Clouds, I didn't realize that BoulderCo also made the memory reduction mod. When I replaced Clouds with an upgraded version, I removed the memory reducer accidentally. I thought I'd download an update to the memory reduction mod, just to see if that had an impact when I discovered it was missing.

Reason I didn't notice is that when I reverted to my (originally working) older version of UR, I simply reinstalled the old copy I still had, which didn't contain the memory reducer.

This is one of the reasons I hate the 'all in one' author mod folder packs

Running all those mods at a cool 2.6Gb again. Seriously, that mod is tits.

False alarm guys, but thanks for offering to help

Edited January 1, 2014 by Frostiken

Glad to hear the issue is fixed. Wow, those memory fix mods sound amazing!

B9 and, to a lesser extent KW, tend to be the ones that rapidly cause memory problems. B9 does come with a reduced texture pack, make sure you install that or you will be close to having problems with B9 alone installed nevermind any other mods. I think KW has reduced texture packs available as well, so make sure you get both. Interstellar is fairly big but not on the scale of those two.

KW has now been optimized to be smaller than it's reduction pack. KW is no longer a problem mod. Also, I can run B9, KW, and other stuff. Never used the B9 reduction pack. Dunno how my memory allocation does it, but my system does wonders and makes that work.
KW came a long way from the 750Mb monstrosity it used to be.

Running all those mods at a cool 2.6Gb again. Seriously, that mod is tits.

False alarm guys, but thanks for offering to help

Haha, sorry about that... if I had known I would end up creating another mod I would have named it differently, but once done, can't undo with these kinds of things.
